Design to Production 1: Formal Production Conventions

In this module, students will collaborate in supervised production groups to create their original responses in studio and on location to the title brief. They will document their progress and skills development in a 1500-word reflective journal.The primary skill developed throughout this module is that each student takes their place in the production process to collaborate effectively in producing the best possible piece of work for their portfolio. Students will also be introduced to the principles of sustainable media production, encouraging them to consider environmental and ethical impacts when designing and executing their projects.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Demonstrate the ability to conceptualise and design a media production project.

+  Demonstrate awareness and knowledge of professional standards through their production work.

+  Exhibit problem-solving skills in media production practice.

+  Produce an initial piece of media production highlighting technical proficiency, innovation, strategic thinking, and essential professional practices including sustainable production.

+  Demonstrate proficiency in independent learning, project management, and selfevaluation skills.
